spirit:hwParameter.spirit:configGroups: 2Cols: TCM APB Slave Address @ Memory Map
2Cols: TCM APB Slave Address @ Memory Map
2Cols: TCM APB Slave Address @ Memory Map
2Cols: TCM APB Slave Address @ Memory Map

spirit:vendorExtensions.actel-cc:script:
Enable('APB_START_ADDR_1', Neq('APB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('APB_END_ADDR_1', Neq('APB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('APB_START_ADDR_0', Neq('APB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('APB_END_ADDR_0', Neq('APB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('TCM_TAS_PRESENT', Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Info('TCM_TAS_PRESENT', 'This will enable an APB slave interface for reading and writing to the TCM from an external core', 'This will enable an APB slave interface for reading and writing to the TCM from an external core');\ Enable('GEN_MUL_TYPE', Gt('GEN_DECODE_RV32', '1'));\ Info('GEN_MUL_TYPE', 'When set to Fabric, multiply operations will complete in 32 clock cycles, using a fabric multiplier.
When set to MACC (Non-Pipelined), multiply operations will complete in the same clock cycle, using the fabric math blocks; however, the maximum operating frequency of the processor will decrease compared to using the fabric multiplier.
When set to MACC (Pipelined) option improves max frequency frequency compared to Non-Pipelined but completes in the next clock cycle.', 'When set to Fabric, multiply operations will complete in 32 clock cycles, using a fabric multiplier.
When set to MACC (Non-Pipelined), multiply operations will complete in the same clock cycle, using the fabric math blocks; however, the maximum operating frequency of the processor will decrease compared to using the fabric multiplier.
When set to MACC (Pipelined) option improves max frequency frequency compared to Non-Pipelined but completes in the next clock cycle.');\ Enable('TCM_START_ADDR_1', Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Enable('TCM_START_ADDR_0', Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Enable('TAS_START_ADDR_1', And(Eq('TCM_TAS_PRESENT', '1'), Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '1')));\ Enable('TAS_START_ADDR_0', And(Eq('TCM_TAS_PRESENT', '1'), Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '1')));\ Enable('TAS_END_ADDR_1', And(Eq('TCM_TAS_PRESENT', '1'), Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '1')));\ Enable('TAS_END_ADDR_0', And(Eq('TCM_TAS_PRESENT', '1'), Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '1')));\ Enable('AXI_START_ADDR_1', Neq('AXI_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('AXI_START_ADDR_0', Neq('AXI_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('AXI_END_ADDR_1', Neq('AXI_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('AXI_END_ADDR_0', Neq('AXI_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('AHB_START_ADDR_1', Neq('AHB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('AHB_START_ADDR_0', Neq('AHB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('AHB_END_ADDR_1', Neq('AHB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('AHB_END_ADDR_0', Neq('AHB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Enable('AXI_SLAVE_MIRROR', Neq('AXI_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Info('AXI_SLAVE_MIRROR', 'This feature can be used to directly connect a single slave component (e.g. RAM) without the need of a bridge', 'This feature can be used to directly connect a single slave component (e.g. RAM) without the need of a bridge');\ Enable('AHB_SLAVE_MIRROR', Neq('AHB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Info('AHB_SLAVE_MIRROR', 'This feature can be used to directly connect a single slave component (e.g. RAM) without the need of a bridge', 'This feature can be used to directly connect a single slave component (e.g. RAM) without the need of a bridge');\ Enable('APB_SLAVE_MIRROR', Neq('APB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'));\ Info('APB_SLAVE_MIRROR', 'This feature can be used to directly connect a single slave component (e.g. RAM) without the need of a bridge', 'This feature can be used to directly connect a single slave component (e.g. RAM) without the need of a bridge');\ Info('GEN_DECODE_RV32', 'This core includes the base RISC-V Integer (I) instruction set, the optional Multiply and Divide (M) instruction set and the optional Compressed (C) instruction set.', 'This core includes the base RISC-V Integer (I) instruction set, the optional Multiply and Divide (M) instruction set and the optional Compressed (C) instruction set.');\ Info('NUM_EXT_IRQS', 'Up to 6 optional external interrupt inputs may be configured in addition to the standard RISC-V External, Software and Machine Timer interrupts included in this core.', 'Up to 6 optional external interrupt inputs may be configured in addition to the standard RISC-V External, Software and Machine Timer interrupts included in this core.');\ Info('VECTORED_INTERRUPTS', 'Enabling vectored interrupts will create an individual interrupt vector for each interrupt in the system.', 'Enabling vectored interrupts will create an individual interrupt vector for each interrupt in the system.');\ Info('TCM_PRESENT', 'Enable local system memory for better performance', 'Enable local system memory for better performance');\ Info('FWD_REGS', 'Enabling this option will enable register forwarding. This will increase area and decrease the maximum operating frequency of the system, while increasing core performance.', 'Enabling this option will enable register forwarding. This will increase area and decrease the maximum operating frequency of the system, while increasing core performance.');\ Info('ECC_ENABLE', 'Enabling ECC will instantiate fabric ECC encoding and decoding logic for the TCM and GPRs.', 'Enabling ECC will instantiate fabric ECC encoding and decoding logic for the TCM and GPRs.');\ Info('DEBUGGER', 'Include JTAG debug feature', 'Include JTAG debug feature');\ Enable('RESET_VECTOR_ADDR_0', Eq('BOOTROM_PRESENT', '0'));\ Info('RESET_VECTOR_ADDR_0', '32 bit Reset Vector Address created from two 16 bit hex values.
The address value must be 32 bit (word) aligned when using I or M extension, but when using the C extension the address value can be 16 bit (halfword) aligned if the first instruction is compressed.
Default 0x8000 0x0000. Note : Leading zeros are suppressed.', '32 bit Reset Vector Address created from two 16 bit hex values.
The address value must be 32 bit (word) aligned when using I or M extension, but when using the C extension the address value can be 16 bit (halfword) aligned if the first instruction is compressed.
Default 0x8000 0x0000. Note : Leading zeros are suppressed.');\ Info('INTERNAL_MTIME', 'Enabling this option will generate an internal MTIME counter and a MTIME output port. MTIME is a read/write register that is memory mapped to the address 0x0200_BFF8.', 'Enabling this option will generate an internal MTIME counter and a MTIME output port. MTIME is a read/write register that is memory mapped to the address 0x0200_BFF8.');\ Info('INTERNAL_MTIME_IRQ', 'Enabling this option will generate an internal MTIME interrupt and a MTIME interrupt output port. It will also generate an MTIMECMP register which is memory mapped to the address 0x0200_4000.', 'Enabling this option will generate an internal MTIME interrupt and a MTIME interrupt output port. It will also generate an MTIMECMP register which is memory mapped to the address 0x0200_4000.');\ Info('GPR_REGS', 'Enabling this option replaces RAM based registers with fabric based registers. This improves throughput performance but will increase resources used and reduce the max operating frequency.', 'Enabling this option replaces RAM based registers with fabric based registers. This improves throughput performance but will increase resources used and reduce the max operating frequency.');\ Enable('MTIME_PRESCALER', Eq('INTERNAL_MTIME', '1'));\ Info('MTIME_PRESCALER', 'The MTIME_PRESCALER decimal value divided by the CLK frequency derives an MTIME timebase, i.e. MTIME timebase = MTIME_PRESCALER/ CLK frequency (Hz) ', 'The MTIME_PRESCALER decimal value divided by the CLK frequency derives an MTIME timebase, i.e. MTIME timebase = MTIME_PRESCALER/ CLK frequency (Hz) ');\ Info('BOOTROM_PRESENT', 'Enabling this option will enable the MIV Bootrom. The reset vector of the core will be set to the address of the bootrom', 'Enabling this option will enable the MIV Bootrom. The reset vector of the core will be set to the address of the bootrom');\ Enable('RECONFIG_BOOTROM', Eq('BOOTROM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Info('RECONFIG_BOOTROM', 'Enabling this option will make the bootrom source and destination addresses writeable', 'Enabling this option will make the bootrom source and destination addresses writeable');\ Enable('RESET_VECTOR_ADDR_1', Eq('BOOTROM_PRESENT', '0'));\ Enable('BOOTROM_SRC_START_ADDR_UPPER', Eq('BOOTROM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Enable('BOOTROM_SRC_START_ADDR_LOWER', Eq('BOOTROM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Enable('BOOTROM_SRC_END_ADDR_UPPER', Eq('BOOTROM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Enable('BOOTROM_SRC_END_ADDR_LOWER', Eq('BOOTROM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Enable('BOOTROM_DEST_ADDR_UPPER', Eq('BOOTROM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Enable('BOOTROM_DEST_ADDR_LOWER', Eq('BOOTROM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Enable('TCM_END_ADDR_1', Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Enable('TCM_END_ADDR_0', Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '1'));\ Validate('AXI Start Address Must Be Less than AXI End Address', Or(And(GtOrEq(Sum(Mul('AXI_END_ADDR_1', '0x10000'), 'AXI_END_ADDR_0'), Sum(Mul('AXI_START_ADDR_1', '0x10000'), 'AXI_START_ADDR_0')), Or(Eq('AXI_MASTER_TYPE', 'AXI3'), Eq('AXI_MASTER_TYPE', 'AXI4'))), Eq('AXI_MASTER_TYPE', 'None')));\ Validate('APB Start Address Must Be Less Than APB End Address', Or(And(GtOrEq(Sum(Mul('APB_END_ADDR_1', '0x10000'), 'APB_END_ADDR_0'), Sum(Mul('APB_START_ADDR_1', '0x10000'), 'APB_START_ADDR_0')), Eq('APB_MASTER_TYPE', 'APB3')), Eq('APB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None')));\ Validate('AXI & APB Memory Map Overlapping"', Or(Or(Eq('APB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'), Eq('AXI_MASTER_TYPE', 'None')), Or(And(And(Gt('AXI_START_ADDR_1', 'APB_START_ADDR_1'), Gt('AXI_START_ADDR_1', 'APB_END_ADDR_1')), And(Gt('AXI_END_ADDR_1', 'APB_START_ADDR_1'), Gt('AXI_END_ADDR_1', 'APB_END_ADDR_1'))), And(And(Less('AXI_START_ADDR_1', 'APB_START_ADDR_1'), Less('AXI_START_ADDR_1', 'APB_END_ADDR_1')), And(Less('AXI_END_ADDR_1', 'APB_START_ADDR_1'), Less('AXI_END_ADDR_1', 'APB_END_ADDR_1'))))));\ Validate('TAS Start Address Must Be Less than TAS End Address', Or(And(GtOrEq(Sum(Mul('TAS_END_ADDR_1', '0x10000'), 'TAS_END_ADDR_0'), Sum(Mul('TAS_START_ADDR_1', '0x10000'), 'TAS_START_ADDR_0')), And(Eq('TCM_TAS_PRESENT', '1'), Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '1'))), Or(Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '0'), Eq('TCM_TAS_PRESENT', '0'))));\ Validate('AHB Start Address Must Be Less than AHB End Address', Or(And(GtOrEq(Sum(Mul('AHB_END_ADDR_1', '0x10000'), 'AHB_END_ADDR_0'), Sum(Mul('AHB_START_ADDR_1', '0x10000'), 'AHB_START_ADDR_0')), Eq('AHB_MASTER_TYPE', 'AHBLite')), Eq('AHB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None')));\ Validate('AHB & APB Memory Overlapping', Or(Or(Eq('APB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'), Eq('AHB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None')), Or(And(And(Gt('AHB_START_ADDR_1', 'APB_START_ADDR_1'), Gt('AHB_START_ADDR_1', 'APB_END_ADDR_1')), And(Gt('AHB_END_ADDR_1', 'APB_START_ADDR_1'), Gt('AHB_END_ADDR_1', 'APB_END_ADDR_1'))), And(And(Less('AHB_START_ADDR_1', 'APB_START_ADDR_1'), Less('AHB_START_ADDR_1', 'APB_END_ADDR_1')), And(Less('AHB_END_ADDR_1', 'APB_START_ADDR_1'), Less('AHB_END_ADDR_1', 'APB_END_ADDR_1'))))));\ Validate('AXI & AHB Memory Overlapping', Or(Or(Eq('AXI_MASTER_TYPE', 'None'), Eq('AHB_MASTER_TYPE', 'None')), Or(And(And(Gt('AHB_START_ADDR_1', 'AXI_START_ADDR_1'), Gt('AHB_START_ADDR_1', 'AXI_END_ADDR_1')), And(Gt('AHB_END_ADDR_1', 'AXI_START_ADDR_1'), Gt('AHB_END_ADDR_1', 'AXI_END_ADDR_1'))), And(And(Less('AHB_START_ADDR_1', 'AXI_START_ADDR_1'), Less('AHB_START_ADDR_1', 'AXI_END_ADDR_1')), And(Less('AHB_END_ADDR_1', 'AXI_START_ADDR_1'), Less('AHB_END_ADDR_1', 'AXI_END_ADDR_1'))))));\ Validate('TCM depth is greater than 256KB, change start and end address range', Or(And(Less(Sum(Mul('TCM_END_ADDR_1', '0x10000'), 'TCM_END_ADDR_0'), Sum('0x40000', Sum(Mul('TCM_START_ADDR_1', '0x10000'), 'TCM_START_ADDR_0'))), Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '1')), Eq('TCM_PRESENT', '0')));\ Validate('BootROM Source Start Address Must Be Less than BootROM Source End Address', Or(And(GtOrEq(Sum(Mul('BOOTROM_SRC_END_ADDR_UPPER', '0x10000'), 'BOOTROM_SRC_END_ADDR_LOWER'), Sum(Mul('BOOTROM_SRC_START_ADDR_UPPER', '0x10000'), 'BOOTROM_SRC_START_ADDR_LOWER')), Eq('BOOTROM_PRESENT', '1')), Eq('BOOTROM_PRESENT', '0')));\

spirit:file.spirit:name: HandBook/Supplementary Resource Utilization and Performance (RUP) Tables.pdf

spirit:vendorExtensions.actel-cc:description:
The MIV_RV32 is a processor core designed to implement the RISC-V instruction set for use in Microchip FPGAs
It includes the following features: Designed for low power FPGA soft-core implementations Supports the RISC-V standard RV32I ISA with optional Multiply and Divide (M) and Compressed (C) extensions Tightly coupled memory is available and size, up to 256Kb max, is defined by address range. BOOTROM feature which will copy an image from a source memory location to a destination memory location and then run code from the destination memory TCM APB Slave (TAS) port to TCM External, Timer and Soft Interrupts Up to six optional external interrupts Vectored and non-vectored interrupt support Optional on-chip debug unit with a JTAG interface AHBL, APB3, and AXI3/AXI4 optional external bus interfaces
